image.altText: A small white fluffy glider with prominent ears, wide eyes and a little button nose peeks out of hole in a tree at night

props.synopsis: The South East Forest Rescue group alleged the Forestry Corporation of NSW did not conduct a broad area habitat search for features of habitat for three species of glider in a northern New South Wales forest.

title.children: High Court verdict provides 'hope amid an escalating extinction crisis'

image.altText: ACT Supreme Court, Magistrates Court, building, generic

props.synopsis: Angus Ross Robertson, 24, was charged with two counts of rape and two acts of indecency on the woman, who was a fellow cadet.

title.children: Man found guilty of raping fellow ADFA cadet

image.altText: A sign on the exterior of an office building that reads "Interchange Health Cooperative".

props.synopsis: A fully bulk-billed GP and allied health clinic in Canberra's south has closed its doors, making what it called a "deeply difficult and disappointing decision" to enter voluntary administration.

title.children: Canberra patients 'devastated' as fully bulk-billed GP closes doors

image.altText: A boat on Lake Burley Griffin

props.synopsis: Police say it's a miracle no one was injured during the cross-border chase. The driver later tested positive to drugs, with police finding weapons in his car.

title.children: Police pursuit ends as driver jumps into Lake Burley Griffin

image.altText: Andrew Laming

props.synopsis: Former Liberal MP Andrew Laming is disputing a fine he has been handed over content he posted online in the lead-up to the 2019 election that did not contain the required authorisations.

title.children: Former MP to appeal in High Court against fine for electoral law breaches

image.altText: A box and vial of the Measles, Mumps, Rubella Virus Vaccine at a vaccine clinic.

props.synopsis: Adults can catch and spread the disease, especially if they are under-vaccinated — a category many Australians might find themselves in. Here's what you need to know about getting fully vaccinated against measles.

title.children: Am I protected against measles? Your vaccine questions answered

image.altText: A single-story house with a large gum tree branch fallen on the roof, causing damage.

props.synopsis: After a tree branch that Canberra resident Terrylea Reynolds had repeatedly reported as being dangerous fell on her house, she's hopeful a law update will help stop the same thing happening to others.

title.children: Terrylea reported a concerning tree. Then its branch fell on her house

image.altText: ABC graphic with powerpoint

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton have been campaigning in Sydney following their first leaders' debate. Follow live.

title.children: Experts, voters weigh in on Australia's energy future in Your Say forum

image.altText: The wreckage of a helicopter on a sand bank with emergency services standing nearby

props.synopsis: The Australian Transport Safety Burea report has found a series of safety issues contributed to the crash that killed four people and injured nine others in 2023.

title.children: 'Limited opportunities' for pilots to detect each other before deadly Sea World crash

image.altText: Elon Musk sits in the Oval Office wearing a red baseball cap that says: "Trump was right about everything"

props.synopsis: Elon Musk calls Donald Trump's top trade adviser a "moron", escalating tensions over tariffs within the US president's inner sanctum, as some White House officials indicate deals could be on the table.

title.children: Musk calls Trump adviser 'dumber than bricks' as tariff blowback escalates

image.altText: Sarah McBride with her daughter conceived through IVF

props.synopsis: Last week the federal health department accepted an expanded definition of infertility that would allow LGBTIQ+ couples and single people like Sarah McBride to be able to access Medicare rebates for assisted reproductive technology.

title.children: 'Socially infertile' people like Sarah can now access Medicare rebates

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Angus Taylor behind a podium.

props.synopsis: Government administration experts have warned that while it is possible to shrink the public service through natural attrition, it would be difficult to avoid impacting service delivery.

title.children: Most public service attrition overlaps with service delivery roles

image.altText: The two divers in the water after being spotted by crew members on board Rottnest Fast Ferries.

props.synopsis: Two brothers who were left behind in the ocean during a diving expedition off the Perth coast say they feared they wouldn't survive the ordeal.

title.children: 'Treated it like a joke': Divers left behind off Perth coast furious at company

image.altText: A photo of a child in an album.

props.synopsis: After a scathing report into South Korea's decades-long baby export program, Australians have launched a petition urging the federal government to investigate the adoptions of about 3,600 children since 1978.

title.children: Australian adoptees call for inquiry in wake of Korean adoptions scandal

image.altText: Peter Navarro walking on the street with a smile

props.synopsis: A year ago, Peter Navarro was serving time in a Miami prison. Today, he's credited with having influence over the US president's tariff plans.

title.children: 'Boys will be boys': Who is the Trump adviser feuding with Elon Musk?

image.altText: a sign which reads, "We Stand with AP" inside the White House

props.synopsis: The ban came after the news agency said it would continue using the name Gulf of Mexico, which prompted President Trump to say he would "keep them out until such time as they agree it's the Gulf of America."

title.children: Judge orders AP's return to White House. Why did Trump ban them?

image.altText: orcas in the ocean and birds flying above the water

props.synopsis: Scientists and tourists are left in awe by a rare and dramatic encounter off the state's south coast.

title.children: Marine biologist and tourists in awe as 60 orcas attack blue whale

image.altText: A box and vial of the Measles, Mumps, Rubella Virus Vaccine at a vaccine clinic.

props.synopsis: Adults can catch and spread the disease, especially if they are under-vaccinated — a category many Australians might find themselves in. Here's what you need to know about getting fully vaccinated against measles.

title.children: Measles is circulating. Do adults need to get vaccinated?

image.altText: A man walking in flood water near a stranded car

props.synopsis: Melioidosis claims the life of another Queensland Health patient in the Townsville region as a microbiologist warns floodwater is pushing dangerous bacteria to the soil's surface.

title.children: Queensland melioidosis death toll climbs as wet weather spreads bacteria

image.altText: Close up of a brunette young woman wearing a stack of necklaces in a sandy location.

props.synopsis: Though Aimee Lou Wood and Walton Goggins are far from unattractive, they both possess features that stand out in Hollywood's often homogenous landscape.

title.children: The White Lotus is changing the face (and smile) of Hollywood

image.altText: Composite image of Charles Dance, Thom Yorke, and Julianne Moore on various red carpets

props.synopsis: Thousands of creatives have signed the petition which calls for an end to the unlicensed use of creative work to train generative AI models.

title.children: Statement against AI training passes 50,000 signatures

image.altText: New Eurovision hosts promo 2

props.synopsis: Former ABC presenter Tony Armstrong and drag icon Courtney Act will present Australia's Eurovision coverage live from Switzerland.

title.children: Tony Armstrong and Courtney Act set to host Australia's Eurovision coverage

image.altText: A four-year-old boy wearing shorts and a t-shirt sits on the grass with a broad smile on his face.

props.synopsis: The mother of a boy who is Deafblind is frustrated after being told her son wouldn't have the one-on-one assistance he needs to understand lessons in his preferred setting.

title.children: Parents 'confused and baffled' by school inclusion policies

image.altText: Cheng Chau Brisbane casino

props.synopsis: Star and its Chinese partner both did business with the disgraced Suncity junket. It is set to cost one of them a share in Australia's most expensive casino.

title.children: Hidden ties to crime figure no barrier for Brisbane casino takeover

image.altText: a composite image of two boys, seen from behind

props.synopsis: Years after two brothers with disabilities were found naked and locked in a room in a Brisbane home, the Queensland Education department has been urged to make sure suspicions of harm are "appropriately recorded".

title.children: Call for better reporting after brothers found naked and malnourished

image.altText: Close-up side profile of a blonde woman with large earrings and red lipstick on a red carpet.

props.synopsis: The pop superstar is bringing her MAYHEM Ball tour to Australia, playing shows at stadiums in Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane.

title.children: Lady Gaga announces first Australian shows in 11 years

image.altText: A small sign inside a roundabout describing locations at Barwon Prison.

props.synopsis: Inmates and staff have been evacuated from an area in the maximum security Barwon Prison following a suspected carbon monoxide leak.

title.children: Barwon Prison inmates evacuated and staff hospitalised following gas leak

image.altText: Min Woo Lee plays a shot at Masters practice

props.synopsis: Jason Day hopes compatriot Min Woo Lee heeds advice given by golf legend Karrie Webb as Lee heads into the Masters as Australia's best bet.

title.children: Lee urged to consider 'lifestyle change' in order to conquer Masters

image.altText: A large southern giant burrowing frog is looking directly to camera.

props.synopsis: Scientists at Melbourne Zoo are celebrating after successfully breeding two critically endangered Victorian frog species in a world-first.

title.children: Hope spawns for 'cryptic' endangered frogs decimated by bushfire

image.altText: Three women with very brightly coloured, large skirts, stands close together smiling, holding their skirts out to side.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest multicultural festivals is a loud and proud celebration of different cultures and their art and performance.

title.children: Bollywood dance, Mariachi, K-Pop and more feature at Australian festival

image.altText: JD Vance speaking at a lectern, a close up photo of him.

props.synopsis: The US vice president's comments have been widely circulated on Chinese social media and received a sharp rebuke from Beijing.

title.children: JD Vance called 'ignorant and impolite' by China over 'peasants' remark

image.altText: a bald male politician wearing glasses speaks in front of a man standing behind him

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's cornerstone east coast gas reservation policy may reduce household electricity bills by "around 3 per cent" in 2026, according to modelling released nearly two weeks after the plan was announced.

title.children: Peter Dutton's gas 'diversion' plan to lower household energy bills by 3 per cent

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy wearing a black top and standing emotionless alongside a Ukrainian flag

props.synopsis: In a post on the encrypted messaging service Telegram, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claims to have information about "significantly more Chinese citizens" serving in Russian military units, and says he has ordered his foreign minister to contact Beijing.

title.children: Zelenskyy says Chinese soldiers captured fighting alongside Russians in Ukraine

image.altText: Vladimir Putin rests his head against his hand, with one finger pointed towards his temple

props.synopsis: The International Criminal Court has issued arrest warrants for Vladimir Putin and Benjamin Netanyahu, but is the court working as it should be?

title.children: Will Putin or Netanyahu ever face the International Criminal Court?

image.altText: A woman with short grey hair stands next to a brightly coloured painting of two women in floral outfits.

props.synopsis: Alfred Wolmark became a pioneering painter after fleeing persecution in Europe in the 1880s. His family hope offering his work in Australia will help keep his legacy alive.

title.children: First Australian public art auction for post-impressionist colour king
